body:
Comment 1: 
I don't have any problems:

C:\go\path\src\a>perl --version

This is perl 5, version 16, subversion 1 (v5.16.1) built for MSWin32-x86-multi-thread
(with 1 registered patch, see perl -V for more detail)

Copyright 1987-2012, Larry Wall

Binary build 1601 [296175] provided by ActiveState http://www.ActiveState.com
Built Aug 30 2012 20:08:55

Perl may be copied only under the terms of either the Artistic License or the
GNU General Public License, which may be found in the Perl 5 source kit.

Complete documentation for Perl, including FAQ lists, should be found on
this system using "man perl" or "perldoc perl".  If you have access to the
Internet, point your browser at http://www.perl.org/, the Perl Home Page.


C:\go\path\src\a>go version
go version devel +318b04f28372 Mon Jun 30 18:59:24 2014 -0700 windows/386

C:\go\path\src\a>type foo.go
package main

import (
        "os"
        "fmt"
        "runtime/pprof"
)

func foo() {
        a := int64(0)
        for i := int64(0); i < 1000000000; i++ {
                a += i
        }
        fmt.Println(a)
}

func main() {
        prof, _ := os.Create("foo.prof")
        defer prof.Close()
        pprof.StartCPUProfile(prof)
        defer pprof.StopCPUProfile()

        foo()
}

C:\go\path\src\a>go build foo.go

C:\go\path\src\a>foo
499999999500000000

C:\go\path\src\a>go tool pprof --text foo.exe foo.prof
Total: 191 samples
     187  97.9%  97.9%      191 100.0% main.foo
       2   1.0%  99.0%        2   1.0% runtime.cgocall
       1   0.5%  99.5%        1   0.5% fmt.(*pp).doPrint
       1   0.5% 100.0%        4   2.1% fmt.Println
       0   0.0% 100.0%        3   1.6% fmt.Fprintln
       0   0.0% 100.0%      191 100.0% main.main
       0   0.0% 100.0%        2   1.0% os.(*File).Write
       0   0.0% 100.0%        2   1.0% os.(*File).write
       0   0.0% 100.0%        2   1.0% os.(*File).writeConsole
       0   0.0% 100.0%      191 100.0% runtime.gosched0
       0   0.0% 100.0%      191 100.0% runtime.main
       0   0.0% 100.0%        2   1.0% syscall.Syscall6
       0   0.0% 100.0%        2   1.0% syscall.WriteConsole

C:\go\path\src\a>

Do tests in %GOROOT%/src/cmd/nm, %GOROOT%/src/cmd/addr2line and %GOROOT%/src/cmd/objdump
succeed on your system? If they do, then you need to debug pprof yourself to see where
it fails. Just let me know, if I can help in any way.

Alex
